creator: posniak@tps.mv.com
text:
Can not get jndi datasource lookup to work with beta 5.

I noticed that TyrexDataSourceFactory.class was not included in any jar so I 
built it and inserted it into naming.jar. Also downloaded tyrex-0.9.7.0.jar and 
put it in the common/lib directory.

When my servet code attempts to do a lookup of the jndi name I see a 
classcastexception somewhere way down in tomcat.

Here is datasource definition from server.xml:

          <Resource name="rob" auth="SERVLET"
                    type="javax.sql.DataSource"/>
          <ResourceParams name="rob">
            <parameter>
				<name>user</name>	
				<value>ftuser</value>
			</parameter>
            <parameter>
				<name>password</name>
				<value>ftuser</value>
			</parameter>
            <parameter>
				<name>driverClassName</name>
	            <value>oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver</value>
			</parameter>
            <parameter><name>driverName</name>
              <value>jdbc:oracle:thin:@gateway:1521:o8ftcs</value>
			</parameter>
          </ResourceParams>
		</Context>

Please let me know if you need any additional information.

Thanks.

I don't believe that the resource factory in compatible with the latest Tyrex.
Could you download Tyrex 0.9.6 and try with that release ?
creator: remm@apache.org
posniak@tps.mv.com
text:
It does indeed work with tyrex-0.9.6.jar.

Thanks very much for your help.

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
I will upgrade the support to Tyrex 0.9.7 when I get the chance (my TODO list is
way too long at the moment).

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
Closed the bug by accident (sorry). I was trying to close the bug right above
that one ...

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
Fixed.
In 0.9.7, the driver had to be registered (it took me a while to find this 
out), although in 0.9.6, the driver was registered automatically.
The factory will have to be modified again to support the next version.
